title: Óscar Rendoll Gómez
text:
Óscar Rendoll Gómez is a former Chilean international <a href="Association%20football">football</a> manager. He was manager of the <a href="Panama%20national%20football%20team">Panama team</a> in the late 1940s and early 1950s, he's best known for winning the nation's first international title; the <a href="CCCF%20Championship">CCCF Championship</a> in 1951.
Previously Rendoll Gómez had led the national football team at the <a href="Football%20at%20the%201946%20Central%20American%20and%20Caribbean%20Games">1946 Central American and Caribbean Games</a>, ending the competition with a runner-up medal.
